ch.aplu.robotsim

Class TouchSensor

  • java.lang.Object
    • Actor
      • ch.aplu.robotsim.Part
        • ch.aplu.robotsim.TouchSensor

  • public class TouchSensor
extends Part
    Class that represents a touch sensor.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TouchSensor(SensorPort port)
      Creates a sensor instance connected to the given port.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void act()
      For internal use only (overrides Actor.act()).
      void addTouchListener(TouchListener listener)
      Register the given TouchListener to detect press or release events.
      boolean isPressed()
      Polls the touch sensor and returns true, if there is a collision with any of the collision obstacles.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • TouchSensor

        public TouchSensor(SensorPort port)
        Creates a sensor instance connected to the given port. The port selection determines the position of the sensor: S1: right; S2: left, S3: middle, S4: rear-middle.
        Parameters:
        port - the port where the sensor is plugged-in

    • Method Detail

      • addTouchListener

        public void addTouchListener(TouchListener listener)
        Register the given TouchListener to detect press or release events. Starts an internal sensor thread that polls the sensor level and runs the sensor callbacks.
        Parameters:
        listener - the LightListener to register; null, to terminate any running sensor thread

      • act

        public void act()
        For internal use only (overrides Actor.act()).

      • isPressed

        public boolean isPressed()
        Polls the touch sensor and returns true, if there is a collision with any of the collision obstacles. Calls Thread.sleep(1) to prevent CPU overload in short polling loops.
        Returns:
        true, if the sensor is pressed; otherwise false
